                         DcMotor.RunMode mode)
        Description copied from interface: DcMotorController

        Specified by:

        motor - the motor port number (1 to 2 or 1 to 4)
        mode - the run mode to use

      • isBusy

        public boolean isBusy(int motor)
        Description copied from interface: DcMotorController
        Returns whether the robot has not yet reached its target position. Don't rely on the return value if not in the RUN_TO_POSITION mode.
        Specified by:
        isBusy in interface DcMotorController
        Parameters:
        motor - the motor port number (1 to 2 or 1 to 4)
        Returns:
        false if the motor has stopped, true otherwise

      • setMotorPower

        public void setMotorPower(int motor,
                          double power)
        Description copied from interface: DcMotorController
        Sets the motor's power, where -1.0 means full power backwards, 0.0 means stopped, and 1.0 means full power forward. In RUN_TO_POSITION mode, sets the maximum power to send to the motor.
        Specified by:
        setMotorPower in interface DcMotorController
        Parameters:
        motor - the motor port number (1 to 2 or 1 to 4)
        power - the desired power

      • getMotorPower

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the motor's power value

      • setMotorTargetPosition

        public void setMotorTargetPosition(int motor,
                                   int position)
        Description copied from interface: DcMotorController
        Sets the desired encoder position for the motor. It will automatically move there (requires an encoder to be attached). Should only be used in the RUN_TO_POSITION mode.
        Specified by:
        setMotorTargetPosition in interface DcMotorController
        Parameters:
        motor - the motor port number (1 to 2 or 1 to 4)
        position - the target encoder position
        See Also:
        DcMotorController.getMotorCurrentPosition(int), DcMotorController.getMotorTargetPosition(int)

      • getMotorTargetPosition

        Description copied from interface: DcMotorController
        Returns the encoder position that the motor has been told to move to if in the RUN_TO_POSITION mode
        Specified by:
        getMotorTargetPosition in interface DcMotorController
        Parameters:
        motor - the motor port number (1 to 2 or 1 to 4)
        Returns:
        the target encoder position
        See Also:

      • getMotorCurrentPosition

        public int getMotorCurrentPosition(int motor)
        Description copied from interface: DcMotorController
        Gets the current value of the encoder. The number of encoder ticks per revolution depends on the motor encoder being used. For example, Tetrix motors have 1440 ticks/rev and Andymark NeveRest 40 motors have 1120.
        Specified by:
        getMotorCurrentPosition in interface DcMotorController
        Parameters:
        motor - the motor port number (1 to 2 or 1 to 4)
        Returns:
        the encoder tick count
